pageContext.claim: “We have the newest finest military we've ever had and gave our great warriors their largest pay raises in many, many decades.”
pageContext.analysis: The Defense Department reports “annual military basic pay raises are linked to the increase in private-sector wages, as measured by the Employment Cost Index.” In other words, an annual raise is not unusual for members of the military. In fact, members of the military have received pay raises every year since 1983. (Ignoring an administrative quirk since 1983.) The 3.1 percent increase from 2020 is the largest increase since 2010 when military earned a 3.4 percent increase.
